reference.shortdesc: Revision information is used to maintain tracking dates that are important in a development cycle, such as the date of the last modification, the original availability date, and the expiration date.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , and the attribute defined below.

dlentry.dd: The last modification date, entered as YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is the year, MM is the month from 01 to 12, and DD is the day from 01-31.

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following example, an author specifies revision information within a topic.
example.codeblock: <prolog> <critdates> <created date="1999-01-01" golive="1999-02-15" expiry="9999-09-09"/> <revised modified="2003-03-03" golive="2002-02-03" expiry="9999-09-09"/> </critdates> </prolog>
example.p: The same information could be specified in a map.
example.codeblock: <topicmeta> <critdates> <created date="1999-01-01" golive="1999-02-15" expiry="9999-09-09"/> <revised modified="2003-03-03" golive="2002-02-03" expiry="9999-09-09"/> </critdates> </topicmeta>
